bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Otto L. Bettmann, August 18, 1948

div1.p: Hench suggests that Bettmann have an assistant look over old magazines for yellow fever illustrations, for Hench has found many valuable ones in these sources.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Otto L. Bettmann, August 18, 1948
div1.opener:
August 18, 1948
The Bettmann Archive
211A East 57th Street
New York 22, New York
My dear Doctor Bettmann:
div1.p:
I am sorry that I neglected to send you the four prints on yellow
fever. I sent you a check some time ago. I have returned these by separate post.

May I make the following suggestion. One day in New York this spring
and a half day in Chicago between trains, I spent in the library, looking over
old illustrated magazines, hunting for old pictures of yellow fever on my own.
I came across quite a few which I had photostated, some were very striking. I
also came across many more interesting illustrations and drawings in various
old illustrated magazines, including some in an old New York daily illustrated
newspaper. I really believe it might be profitable if you would consider the
following suggestion.

I would suggest that if you can spare one of your trained personnel
who knows what type of calls come to you, let her go systematically to the New
York Public Library a half day a week or longer and just leaf through the old
illustrated magazines and newspapers. I am sure in this way you could find
many, many more items than you now have available. She could merely index them;
you wouldn't even have to have them photostated now, you could merely make a file
of what they are and a potential customer wouldn't even have to know that you
didn't have them on hand. You could have them photostated when necessary and
thus notably increase your stock. I have, on my own, probably found five times
or more as many interesting items on yellow fever as you have in your stock.
I hope you do not believe me presumptuous in making this suggestion.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
